oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Miller, Harry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Harry Miller served as Director of The American University in Cairoâ€™s Center for Adult and Continuing Education (CACE) from 1992 to 2005. Miller outlines changes he introduced including structural reorganization (with Divisions for English, Arabic, Computer, Business, and other studies), unified curriculum, and new financial controls. He describes CACE instructors and students, and covers its accreditation, branches throughout Egypt and overseas, new initiatives like summer programs and e-learning, and the major USAID English Language Testing and Training program. The role and reputation of CACE and other continuing education units at the university are discussed, as are the impact of presidential leadership, financial challenges, and aspects of AUC administrative and workplace culture. Miller offers comparisons between continuing education at AUC and in Egypt and at his previous workplaces in the U.S., and speaks of the potential impact of the new campus under-construction.
